Terms used throughout this guide.
Link to a definition from elsewhere on the site using `[term](/resources/glossary.qmd#nowcasting)`.

## N

### Nowcasting {#nowcasting}

Estimating the current state of an outcome by adjusting for reporting delays using historical patterns.

## D

### Data vintage {#data-vintage}

A snapshot of a dataset at a particular point in time, capturing the state of reporting at that moment.

## R

### Reference date {#reference-date}

The date an event occurred (e.g. symptom onset, hospital admission).

### Report date {#report-date}

The date an event appeared in the surveillance system.

### Reporting delay {#reporting-delay}

The time between an event occurring and it appearing in surveillance data.

### Reporting triangle {#reporting-triangle}

A data structure organising counts by both event date and reporting date, used as input to nowcasting methods.

### Right-truncation {#right-truncation}

The systematic undercounting of recent events because not all cases have been reported yet.
